issue.title: Add the SpamBug model to the HTTP service

repository.name: bugbug
repository.description: Platform for Machine Learning projects on Software Engineering

issue.body:
We need the HTTP service to support the SpamBug model too (it should just be a matter of adding the trainining task as a dependency of the http service task, and add the spambug model to the http service models in https://github.com/mozilla/bugbug/blob/75939c52a010666a776a9d1c4f41e01397c9918e/http_service/models.py#L23).

This is the last step required before being able to put the model in production in https://github.com/mozilla/relman-auto-nag. Well, the actual real last step is going to be in https://github.com/mozilla/relman-auto-nag itself :)

issue.title: Add SpamBug model to relman-auto-nag

repository.name: bugbug
repository.description: Platform for Machine Learning projects on Software Engineering

issue.body:
First of all, we need to fix #1200, otherwise the model fails during training.

Then, in relman-auto-nag, we need something like https://github.com/mozilla/relman-auto-nag/blob/master/auto_nag/scripts/stepstoreproduce.py and https://github.com/mozilla/relman-auto-nag/blob/57fae814cb1d5c56cbb4e808784b3a21031aff28/auto_nag/scripts/configs/tools.json#L580-L603.
Assuming you will name the script "spam.py", you can run it this way: python -m auto_nag.scripts.spam --dryrun. You might need some minimal configuration for it to run, let me know (here or on IRC) if you run into issues and I'll help you.

body: @marco-c Does this mean it is running out of memory? Training the model locally works just fine for me.

Yep!
Do you have up-to-date dependencies (pip3 install -r requirements.txt)? Maybe a new version of a dependency is using more memory than before?
How much RAM do you have? We can also just increase the RAM available for the job.

Ah, I just realized it crashes for me too. I wasn't patient enough to wait for the entire training period, hence after seeing the initial metrics I figured the rest might also be working fine for me.

I'm on 16 gigs of RAM and this is failing for me. @marco-c I think the only option here is increasing the ram be have for this job?
@ayush-1506 or we can disable feature importance, that should fix it too.

issue.title: Disable feature importance for spambug model

repository.name: bugbug
repository.description: Platform for Machine Learning projects on Software Engineering

issue.body:
Fixes: #1200 

Tried it locally, training the model doesn't crash anymore. Once this is merged, we can move ahead with using the model in relman-auto-nag.
